comment: The professor was super kind and helpful whenever I was confused with the material. Gave plenty of extra credit and definitely seemed motivated to get students to pass. I took him over the summer so he sped past a lot of the material but was still nice enough to not make us cram literally everything for tests. I don't even like math classes.

worst professor i have taken my whole college career. lied about giving me extra credit points, pretty much useless lectures (had to teach myself basically everything with yt videos), and just overall not a helpful teacher at all. there are many better options i would definitely stay away from this guy if you can.

Honestly, his class is hard, but if you do the homework and you go to class every day, you should be fine. He gives a lot of extra credit opportunities please take them because, in the end, you will see a difference and the hw questions are the quizzes.

Made a 92 in the class but with his grading scale it counted as a B. He doesn't explain concepts well so you'll end up teaching yourself. Very difficult to reach him outside of class, wasn't good at responding to emails and when I tried going to his office hours he was nowhere to be found.More than half the class dropped by the end of the semester.
dude stinks, worst teacher I ever had
DO NOT take this guy if you want to do well in this class. Does not use d2l at all, heavy accent, cannot teach for his life

I would give this professor a 0 if I could, easily the worst teacher I've ever had. He only reads off of the lecture slides, and yet insists you come to class, and whenever you try to ask him a question, he seem to get annoyed with you for even asking. He does not post grades, and does not respond to his email. He is a harsh grader. STAY AWAY!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Professor does not know how to teach. I went to office hours, all the professor said was he already explained it in class. The professor teaches a weird syllabus, and uses copy pastes from the textbook, claiming he solved the problem. Does not check homework clearly, so even if you get it wrong, all he will do is give you a sheet with answers.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment:
1. Skipped set theory, proofs, and logic and introduces topics that he just assumes we know (basically teaching calculus to a middle schooler)
2. Going super in depth for no reason and does not teach connects in the homework
3. Nothing is put in d2l and everything is on paper so you don't know your grade
4. I Emailed him about it but no response
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Do not take this professor!! The course is hard enough as it is without a professor who won't teach. He also doesn't put anything online, including access to the online textbook you will need for this class and that you paid for. You can't see your grade online either, and won't know it until the end of the semester.

Avoid him at all costs! He doesn't know how to communicate with students or even his own department. He leaves out so many details when explaining things that barely anything he says makes sense. Nothing is online, he paces the course horribly, and he doesn't even teach all the right curriculum. Do not take him, even if he's the only one left.

Took discrete math with him. He is knowledgeable and knows what he is talking about; he has a Wikipedia page too, an Iranian Engineer.

This being said, he is not a great teacher. He doesn't seem to grasp how to communicate his ideas affectively with his students. I am not sure how my grade will turn out this semester and I worry about a low grade.
